body_html:
One thing that is wrong at times is

>>> if True:
...    cool_stuff()

Probably either using ... (like python) or spaces (for copy-paste benefit) is better.
I have a regenerator that successfully checks most of the valid (ha! there are quite a few old "numel matches but the shapes are incompatible" examples that are invalid these days, e.g. add) torch docstrings.
I would be very happy to contribute that. My suggestion would be to do this as a test that fails on a mismatch and an optional command "print fixes" or so that outputs the correct things.

I don't want to interfere with any one else cleaning up these things (@li-roy ?), but I'd be happy to have a go at fixing all the docs.

body:
One thing that is wrong at times is
```
>>> if True:
...    cool_stuff()
```
Probably either using `...` (like python) or spaces (for copy-paste benefit) is better.
I have a regenerator that successfully checks most of the valid (ha! there are quite a few old "numel matches but the shapes are incompatible" examples that are invalid these days, e.g. `add`) torch docstrings.
I would be very happy to contribute that. My suggestion would be to do this as a test that fails on a mismatch and an optional command "print fixes" or so that outputs the correct things.

I don't want to interfere with any one else cleaning up these things (@li-roy ?), but I'd be happy to have a go at fixing all the docs.
